training_organizations.name: Nevada Partnership for Training (UNR/UNLV)
training_organizations.description: A collaborative training program involving Nevada’s Division of Child and Family Services and the state’s universities (University of Nevada, Reno and UNLV). It delivers standardized training curriculum to child welfare staff in Nevada’s unique state-county hybrid system. The Partnership for Training ensures that both rural state-operated offices and urban county agencies (like Clark County DFS) receive consistent, high-quality training for their CPS workers.

training_organizations.name: Raise the Future (The Adoption Exchange)
training_organizations.description: A nonprofit serving Nevada (and other states) that focuses on finding adoptive families for youth in foster care and supporting permanency. Formerly known as The Adoption Exchange, Raise the Future works with Nevada’s child welfare agencies to match children (especially older youth or those with special needs) with adoptive homes and provides support services to those families. This partnership expands the state’s capacity to achieve permanency for children who might otherwise age out of foster care.

training_organizations.name: Evident Change (Structured Decision Making)
training_organizations.description: Nevada’s child welfare agencies utilize the Structured Decision Making assessment tools from Evident Change to evaluate risk and safety in abuse/neglect cases:contentReference[oaicite:28]{index=28}. Evident Change provides these tools and related training for Nevada’s statewide system (which is state-supervised and county-administered), helping ensure a uniform approach to critical decisions like removals and case openings.

healthy_marriage.recipient_name: INTERNATIONAL CHURCH OF LAS VEGAS, INC.

policies.TribalFoster: No, Tribes within state do not provide foster care
policies.DecentralScreen: Some counties/region have own screening unit
policies.FatalitiesReview: Yes, reviews are required for all or some cases
policies.AlternativeResponse: Yes--implemented in specific counties or regions
policies.NearFatalitiesReview: Yes, reviews are required for all or some cases
policies.DecentralizedReporting: Some counties/region have own reporting hotline
policies.ReportInfo_OtherSpecify: Additional information is requested when law enforcement is the reporting party, such as whether they are requesting immediate Child Protective Services (CPS) response, circumstances that led to law enforcement involvement, whether law enforcement agency is responding or have they already responded, any additional concerns; Additional information is collected for the following reports: 1) educational neglect (documentation from the school district that includes how the absences are due to the faults and habits of the child's parents), 2) Substance Exposed Infant/Comprehensive Addiction and Recovery Act (CARA) Plan of Care (the nature and extent of the effects of the prenatal alcohol and/or drug exposure on the newborn and the nature of the withdrawal symptoms, Neonatal Abstinence Syndrome (NAS) including the medical diagnosis and/or copy lab results), and 3) child fatalities/near fatalities (whether the fatality or near fatality is related to abuse or neglect, whether there are other children living in the household, statement from a licensed physician or health care professional that the child is in serious or critical condition or that resuscitative efforts were performed)
policies.InvestQual_TrainingSpecify: Initial training: Nevada Child Welfare Training Academy Pre-Service Training Program; Ongoing training: At least 30 hours of continuing education in the field of child welfare practice every 2 years from the date of hire, including 4 hours related to ethics in the practice of social work
policies.AltResp_Inelig_OtherSpecify: Institutional abuse or neglect; Active drug raid; Failure to thrive or severe malnutrition; Manufacturing of illegal substances; Medical neglect indicating serious medical condition that could cause substantial and immediate harm
policies.AntiDiscrim_Staff_VarySpecify: (1) Age, race, disability, religion, and national origin are specified for staff from child welfare agency; (2) Gender identity or expression and sexual orientation are specified   for staff from child welfare agency, contracted child welfare provider organizations, foster parents, and kinship caregivers
policies.FatalitiesDefine_OtherSpecify: The cessation of life, manifested in people by a loss of heart beat, absence of spontaneous breathing, and the permanent loss of brain function; Loss of life
policies.ScreenRiskAssess_OtherSpecify: The type of assessment or procedure is not specified
policies.AltResp_EligibilityMaltreatment: Only certain types of maltreatment are eligible
policies.CaseManagerQual_TrainingSpecify: Initial training: Nevada Child Welfare Training Academy Pre-Service Training Program and 5 week classroom training and 5 week on-the-job training on agency specific procedures; Ongoing training: At least 30 hours of continuing education in the field of child welfare practice every 2 years from the date of hire, including 4 hours related to ethics in the practice of social work
policies.AltResp_Eligibility_OtherSpecify: Cases without repeated abuse/neglect; Child not currently an open case or currently in protective custody; Alleged perpetrator is not a Child Welfare Agency employee or volunteer, foster parent, prospective adoptive parent, or school employee or volunteer; Family can does not have history of refusing differential response services; No active drug raid; No actively suicidal parents or children; No weapon used to threaten or harm anyone in the house
policies.ExtFosterCare_Criteria_OtherSpec: Save enough money to pay for their monthly expenses for at least 3 months; Secure housing; Have adequate income to meet their monthly expenses; Identify an adult who will be available to provide support; If applicable, have established appropriate supportive services to address any mental health or developmental needs; If a child is not capable of achieving one or more of the goals, the child must have goals that are appropriate for the child based upon the needs of the child
policies.ScreenReq_RiskAssessCase_Specify: Reports with present or impending danger
